title: Take a Printout
content:
You can take a printout in following easy steps:

  • Click the three dots on the right hand side and scroll to Print
  • Alternatively, use keyboard shortcut depending on which operating system you have: For Windows and Linux: Ctrl + P. Mac: ⌘ + P
  • In the pop up window select the printer in case you have multiple printers, change any print settings you want and press Print

title: Improve Readability by Increasing the Zoom
content:
If you are having issues reading the text on the website then you may increase the font size. It can be done in following ways:

  • Click the three dots on the right hand side and scroll to Zoom
  • Press + to increase the font size
  • Alternatively, use keyboard shortcuts depending on which operating system you have: For Windows and Linux: Ctrl and +. Mac: ⌘ and +

title: Add This Website to Your Bookmarks
content:
If you frequently visit this website and want to access this in one click, the easiest way is to add it as a Bookmark. Next time you open Chrome, you can see this icon below the search bar and on clicking the icon, you will be redirected to this website. You can add Bookmarks in following way:

  • Click on the Star to the right hand side of the search bar
  • Click the three dots on the right hand side and scroll to Bookmarks
  • Click Add to Bookmarks
  • Alternatively, use keyboard shortcuts depending on which operating system you have: For Windows and Linux: Ctrl and D. Mac: ⌘ and D

title: Problem Loading? Simply Refresh the Page
content:
If you are having issues on this website, you can simply refresh the page. It can be done in following ways:

  • Click on the Refresh icon to the left hand side of the search bar
  • For hard refresh, use keyboard shortcuts depending on which operating system you have: For Windows and Linux: Ctrl and Reload button or Ctrl and F5. Mac: ⌘ and Shift and R or Shift and Reload button

title: Going Back or Forward, Move to Top or Bottom
content:
There are several shortcuts you may use to make it easier to navigate a webpage.

  • You can click the back buttonor forward button to go backward or forward respectively
  • For scrolling to the top or bottom use keyboard shortcuts depending on which operating system you have: Windows and Linux: Ctrl and Up/Down key. Mac: ⌘ and Up/Down key

title: Bring Back Closed Tabs
content:
Closed a tab by mistake? Don't worry, you can bring it right back.

  • Use keyboard shortcuts depending on which operating system you have: Windows and Linux: Ctrl and Shift and T. Mac: ⌘ and Shift and T

title: Jump to Specific Tabs
content:
If you have multiple tabs open and you want to jump to a specific tab you can do it quickly.

  • Use keyboard shortcuts depending on which operating system you have: Windows and Linux: Ctrl and Tab Number (between 1 and 9). Mac: ⌘ and Tab Number (between 1 and 9)

title: Searching for Something Specific on the Webpage
content:
If it is hard to find something in particular, and no amount of scrolling is getting you there fast enough, you can always use the shortcut below.

  • Use keyboard shortcuts depending on which operating system you have: Windows and Linux: Ctrl and F. Mac: ⌘ and F

title: Tired of too many pop-ups? Let us take care of that
content:
Pop-ups can be irritating and can be easily taken care of. The following steps will help take care of unwanted ads, popups and malware.

  • Click on the three dots on the right hand side of the browser and scroll down to Settings
  • In the search bar, type Pop
  • Pop will be highlighted in Yellow, scroll there and click Site Settings
  • Click Popups and Redirects
  • Turn the button to On

title: Found something interesting and want to share it with friends and family?
content:
In case you come across something interesting on this webpage and want to share it, you can simply do the following:

  • Follow same steps as taking a print
  • In Destination, select save as PDF
  • You can then email the PDF via email
